intro: Ormocarpum gracile, commonly known as slender false holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ormocarpum gracile typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and desert scrub ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
